newsitem.title: INDIA: INDIAN HEADLINE STOCKS-factors to watch - Oct 22.
newsitem.headline: INDIAN HEADLINE STOCKS-factors to watch - Oct 22.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors affecting Indian stock markets on Tuesday morning.
** Indian stock markets expected to rise after central bank loosens purse strings, puts pressure on high interest rates
** The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) cuts cash reserve requirements for banks by two percentage points to 10 percent
** The RBI also reduced interest ceiling on 30 days to one-year deposit to 10 percent from 11 percent
** Prime lending rate likely to come down to 14.5-17 percent from 15.5-19 percent
** The central bank governor sees the rupee stable, sees no depreciation
** The RBI's six-month monetary policy gives hope of industrial revival, reverse overall economic slowdown
** The spot dollar/rupee INR= opened little changed at 35.66/69 per dollar, seen range-bound

** Indian markets were closed on Monday for a national holiday. In kerb deals, State Bank of India was quoted at 226 rupees against previous close of 218.75, Reliance 201 against 196.75 and TISCO 176 against 172.50.
** On Monday, the HSBC James Capel Indian GDR Index JCEAI rose 3.98 points, 6.46 percent, to 65.59 with the premium over the local market at 17.89 percent
